segments.en: Linked Discourses 22
6. Involvement
57. Seven Cases
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividhūpaparikkhī imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā uttamapurisoti vuccati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, in this teaching and training a mendicant who is skilled in seven cases and who examines in three ways is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.
And how is a mendicant skilled in seven cases?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu rūpaṃ pajānāti, rūpasamudayaṃ pajānāti, rūpanirodhaṃ pajānāti, rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant understands form, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

segments.pli: rūpassa assādaṃ pajānāti, rūpassa ādīnavaṃ pajānāti, rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: They understand form’s gratification, drawback, and escape.
They understand feeling …
perception …
choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇasamudayaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇanirodhaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ pajānāti;
segments.en: consciousness, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.

segments.pli: viññāṇassa assādaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇassa ādīnavaṃ pajānāti, viññāṇassa nissaraṇaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand consciousness’s gratification, drawback, and escape.
And what is form?

segments.pli: Cattāro ca mahābhūtā, catunnañca mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya rūpaṃ.
segments.en: The four primary elements, and form derived from the four primary elements.
This is called form.
Form originates from food.
When food ceases, form ceases.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo rūpanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of form is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yaṃ rūpaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ—
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from form: this is its gratification.
That form is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
Removing and giving up desire and greed for form: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpasamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpanirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya;
segments.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known form in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation;

segments.pli: evaṃ rūpassa assādaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpassa ādīnavaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
segments.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and are practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form: they are practicing well.

segments.pli: Ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.
segments.en: Those who practice well have a firm footing in this teaching and training.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ rūpaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpasamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpanirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya;
segments.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known form in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation;

segments.pli: evaṃ rūpassa assādaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpassa ādīnavaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ rūpassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya rūpassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā.
segments.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, are freed by not grasping: they are well freed.
Those who are well freed are consummate ones.

segments.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṃ tesaṃ natthi paññāpanāya.
segments.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.
And what is feeling?
There are these six classes of feeling:
feeling born of eye contact …
feeling born of mind contact.
This is called feeling.
Feeling originates from contact.
When contact ceases, feeling ceases.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of feelings is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yaṃ vedanaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ—
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from feeling: this is its gratification.
That feeling is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
Removing and giving up desire and greed for feeling: this is its escape. …

segments.pli: Ye hi, keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ vedanaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ vedanāsamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ vedanānirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ vedanānirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya;
evaṃ vedanāya assādaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ vedanāya ādīnavaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ vedanāya nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya vedanāya nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
Ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.
Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ vedanaṃ abhiññāya … pe …

segments.en: And what is perception?
There are these six classes of perception:

segments.pli: rūpasaññā, saddasaññā, gandhasaññā, rasasaññā, phoṭṭhabbasaññā, dhammasaññā.
segments.en: perceptions of sights, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and thoughts.
This is called perception.
Perception originates from contact.
When contact ceases, perception ceases.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo saññānirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of perceptions is simply this noble eightfold path …
And what are choices?
There are these six classes of intention:
intention regarding sights …
intention regarding thoughts.
These are called choices.
Choices originate from contact.
When contact ceases, choices cease.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo saṅkhāranirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of choices is simply this noble eightfold path …

segments.pli: Yaṃ saṅkhāre paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ—

Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ saṅkhāre abhiññāya, evaṃ saṅkhārasamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ saṅkhāranirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ saṅkhāranirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya … pe … saṅkhārānaṃ nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā te suppaṭipannā.
Ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti … pe …

segments.en: And what is consciousness?
There are these six classes of consciousness:

segments.pli: cakkhuviññāṇaṃ, sotaviññāṇaṃ, ghānaviññāṇaṃ, jivhāviññāṇaṃ, kāyaviññāṇaṃ, manoviññāṇaṃ.
segments.en: eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousness.
This is called consciousness.
Consciousness originates from name and form.
When name and form cease, consciousness ceases.

segments.pli: Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo viññāṇanirodhagāminī paṭipadā, seyyathidaṃ—
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of consciousness is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:
right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

segments.pli: Yaṃ viññāṇaṃ paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ—
segments.en: The pleasure and happiness that arise from consciousness: this is its gratification.
That consciousness is impermanent, suffering, and perishable: this is its drawback.
Removing and giving up desire and greed for consciousness: this is its escape.

segments.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ viññāṇaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇasamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇanirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya;
segments.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known consciousness in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation;

segments.pli: evaṃ viññāṇassa assādaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇassa ādīnavaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya viññāṇassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipannā, te suppaṭipannā.
segments.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and are practicing for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding consciousness: they are practicing well.

segments.pli: Ye suppaṭipannā, te imasmiṃ dhammavinaye gādhanti.
segments.en: Those who practice well have a firm footing in this teaching and training.

segments.pli: Ye ca kho keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā evaṃ viññāṇaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇasamudayaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇanirodhaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ abhiññāya;
segments.en: Those ascetics and brahmins who have directly known consciousness in this way—and its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation;

segments.pli: evaṃ viññāṇassa assādaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇassa ādīnavaṃ abhiññāya, evaṃ viññāṇassa nissaraṇaṃ abhiññāya viññāṇassa nibbidā virāgā nirodhā anupādā vimuttā, te suvimuttā.
segments.en: its gratification, drawback, and escape—and due to disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding consciousness, are freed by not grasping: they are well freed.
Those who are well freed are consummate ones.

segments.pli: Ye kevalino vaṭṭaṃ tesaṃ natthi paññāpanāya.
segments.en: For consummate ones, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sattaṭṭhānakusalo hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is skilled in seven cases.
And how does a mendicant examine in three ways?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu dhātuso upaparikkhati, āyatanaso upaparikkhati, paṭiccasamuppādaso upaparikkhati.
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant examines the elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividhūpaparikkhī hoti.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant examines in three ways.

segments.pli: Sattaṭṭhānakusalo, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tividhūpaparikkhī, imasmiṃ dhammavinaye kevalī vusitavā ‘uttamapuriso’ti vuccatī”ti.
segments.en: In this teaching and training, a mendicant who is skilled in seven cases and who examines in three ways is called consummate, accomplished, a supreme person.”

suttaplex.blurb: To be fully accomplished, a mendicant should investigate the five aggregates in light of the four noble truths, as well as their gratification, drawback, and escape. In addition, they should investigate the elements, sense fields, and dependent origination.
